title.label: Pretty cool game, but also kinda weird

content.label:
Sonic CD is a bit of a weird game in my opinion. Don't get me wrong, it‚Äôs still an absolute classic, but there are some things that I find a little strange.

First, the level design. I mean, Sonic games were always known for having multiple paths to take to get to the end, each one letting you go faster/slower than another. But here, there are WAY too many paths. And the thing is, none of them seem to improve your speed all that much. The only reason for the sheer size of these levels is to hide all of the secrets, like the Metal Sonic projector, and the Flower Capsule.

Also, the secrets. I have no idea how to unlock any of them. Most of them are marked as "???", with the exception of the "D.A. Garden", and I have no clue what that means. I understand that I could probably just look it up on YouTube, but I guess I'm just too lazy to do that.

Besides that, this is a great game. The music is catchy, (Well, the Japanese music is. The US music is downright creepy.) the levels are fun, despite being humongous, and Tails is always a pleasant surprise. Though, if I had to choose between this and Sonic 2, I'd play Sonic 2 any day.

An enjoyable game, though not as fun as Sonic 1 or 2. Enemies sometimes don‚Äôt stand out well against the background. Most notably, it‚Äôs not possible to go back and play previous levels after you‚Äôve ‚Äúbeaten‚Äù the game as you can with the mobile versions of Sonic 1 and 2. Instead, the saved games stay on the final level, so you can‚Äôt return to collect all the time stones, which is a real shame because there is so much to explore with the past/present/future dynamic. This would be a much better game with this feature.

This game is great, with large, expansive levels and unique gimmicks like the time traveling changing the level design and music. The addition of Tails being playable is great, and the bonus content is nice too. But there‚Äôs some bugs that have shown up since these games became free to play with ads. Sometimes, after an ad finishes and you close it, the game gets weirdly stretched and cropped, so it‚Äôs nearly impossible to play. Also, sometimes the music and all but a few sound effects get completely muted, which is a shame since this game has an amazing soundtrack. The screen cropping issue also happens in the Sonic 1 and 2 remakes too. If you fix these bugs this review would easily go up to 5 stars. Also release the Sonic 1 and 2 remakes on consoles and Steam please.

Where do I begin? For the most part, I like this game. A lot. However, there are issues. The issue with the mobile port compared to the others is the controls. The controls are decent in the other mobile sonic ports. You can adjust size and position. However, in cd, you‚Äôre stuck with the default controls. The dpad is minuscule. I commonly would be holding right and end up pressing up. This wouldn‚Äôt be an issue, except for the time travel and the metal sonic fight. Honestly, I would give this game 4 stars if you have a controller. Don‚Äôt use the screen.

This game is great, I‚Äôm glad they brought it back, (although we are still waiting for a certain game *cough* 3 and K) it does however have some issues. Like the previous review, you do not get a level select after beating the game, however the original level select is still available through time attack, as is debug which doesn‚Äôt work at all, sound test, DA garden, and visual mode. In order to get those, you have to get certain times on time attack and special stage time attack. The ads are not an issue for me, because if you are able to turn a vpn on your phone or iPad then it blocks all the ads in the game except for those from Sega. If they are going to add tails to this game, then they might as well add knuckles. So basically what I‚Äôm saying is if you make debug mode work and minimize the ads a little you will have five stars from me. Also maybe add super sonic to give a little motivation for getting the time stones BESIDES the good future. Also for those of you who are unaware NEVER use the US soundtrack. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!!!

This game would be 5 stars out 5, but I think most people know why it isn‚Äôt. The ads are super dumb. Why would we pay for an ad free experience if we just get them every time we launch the game or go to the main menu? It doesn‚Äôt make sense. I feel like it should be the way sonic 2 was before it became free, you pay for the game (or at least no ads) and then there are absolutely none to hinder your gameplay. Another thing I was wondering about: we have to do so many things to unlock the sound test and level select extras, can‚Äôt we also use debug mode on mobile? It would make doing those tedious tasks actually worth it. Please consider taking advice from this review section. (6/9/2020)
